meanings.definition: The act of tearing apart or separating violently.
meanings.sent1: The divulsion of the paper was so loud.
meanings.sent2: The divulsion of the fabric was unexpected.
meanings.sent3: The divulsion of the cake was a messy surprise.
meanings.sent4: The divulsion of the clouds revealed a clear sky.
meanings.sent5: The divulsion of the tree roots was like nature's own earthquake.

meanings.definition: The act of revealing or making known something previously hidden or secret.
meanings.sent1: The divulsion of the truth brought relief.
meanings.sent2: The divulsion of the secret shocked everyone.
meanings.sent3: The divulsion of the joke made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The divulsion of the mystery solved the case.
meanings.sent5: The divulsion of the treasure map led to adventure.
